column1: For the best editing experience, upload this .csv as a rubric in Microsoft Teams.
Design and implement a database VIEW to fetch data from the dvdrental database. Build a node.js app using Express, EJS, and pg to access the database via a RESTful API.
Designed and Implemented a database VIEW that fetches the data required by the chosen user story.
column2: Database design includes a Many-to-Many relationship implemented within three or more database tables.
column4: Database design includes one well designed table.
column6: Database design includes one database table with poor field naming and poor data typing.
column8: Database design is incomplete. Database table is only partially implemented.
column10: No database table has been implemented or table implemented show no understanding of good database design.

column1: Created a well designed file naming and folder structure for a modular full stack application.
column2: Database and tables all have CREATE statements with well designed PK and FK constraints implemented.
column4: Database and table have CREATE statements including auto-increment PK constraint.
column6: Database and table have CREATE statements without PK constraint. Naming and data types reflect what is in design.
column8: Database and table have CREATE statements are only partially complete.
column10: Database and table have CREATE statement does not exist or shows no understanding of database and table creation.

column1: Developed a multi-file project which successfully implements a data access layer service, routes, and a user interface view. The modules successfully implement the features described in the user story.
column2: Solution includes two well structured files with good use of space and code structure. All functions have comments to explain functionality and have a section for revision history.
column4: Solution includes two well structured files with use of space and reasonable code structure. Code comments are terse.
column6: Solution includes two  structured files with use of space and reasonable code structure. Code comments are terse or non-existent.
column8: Solution does not include two structured files and / or the files are poorly organized. Code comments are terse or non-existent.
column10: File and code modularization is non-exitent.  Code is unmanageble.

column1: Well designed and correctly implemented DAL module for fetching data from the postgresql database VIEW.
column2: Exemplary work. RESTful API features are comprehensive for the M:M database table design. Variety of API parameters supported to execute SQL WHERE clauses for database   searching. RESTful API design is easily understood.
column4: RESTful API is complete to retrieve data from single table database design. Ability to fetch all data and a specific row as determined by PK value are both present. RESTful API design is well though out.
column6: RESTful API is mostly complete with ability to retrieve data from single table database design. Ability to fetch data and a specific row as determined by PK value are both present. RESTful API design could be improved.
column8: RESTful API is partially complete with some ability to retrieve data from single table database design. Ability to fetch data and a specific row as determined by PK value are NOT both present. RESTful API design could be improved.
column10: Project looks to have been attempted and is incomplete. Student was unable to implement a working solution.

column1: Well designed and correctly implemented routes which control the logical flow of the application.
Well designed and correctly implemented user inteface views programmed in html with embedded javascript (ejs).

column2: All problem files are present within a single zip file as requested. Archived files are well named to ease evaluation of QAP. Items are very well organized enabling the instructor to assess completion in a quick and easy manner.
column4: All problem files are present within a single zip file as requested. Archived files are well named to ease evaluation of QAP.
column6: Most problem files are present within a single zip file as requested. Archived files are named but difficult to assess each problems solution.
column8: Less than half of the problem files are present within a single zip file as requested, or multiple zip files were provided. Archived files are named, but difficult to assess each problems solution.
column10: Very difficult to assess QAP completion. Additional work is required.
